intro: Pontia vulgaris, commonly known as the small white butterfly weed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and hairy, with small, white, four-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in a variety of environmental conditions. The plant is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
